NOTES: Provide location of directory where input data is and where output will go seperated by \
Provide the input file name (needs to be a comma delimited csv file or xlsx. Include name and the .csv or .xlsx extention here)
Provide the 'extra' input file name if required. If not required enter the word "none"
Provide a filename for the output plot. Do not add extention just the name.
Provide instruction to save as either svg, pdf or png using the terms svg, png or pdf. Specify a single format or two or three seperated by commas only if all are required.
Provide dots per inch for png output if png has been selected. A number can be left here whether png has been selected or not

Specify overall size of entire plot X dimension in centimetres (X is the depth axis dimension as plot is plotted in portrait, see manual for illustration). Size dictated to extent by your screen size.
Specify overall size of entire plot Y dimension in centimetres (Y is the plot size across with all graphs, see manual for illustration). Size dictated to extent by your screen size.
Provide font style of entire plot from either Arial, Calibri, Dejavu sans or Times New Roman.

ENTRY: Keighley Moor - West Yorkshire - England, macrofossil record
NOTES: Provide title text if an overall title is required. If this overruns in to plots can use overall dimensions to adjust or reduce font size
Specify if title text is to be visible or not. Enter word "on" or "off".
X postion of start of title. In page units not data units. 0 is far left of visible page, 1 far right. Remember plots are in portrait so X is the depth axis (see manual).
Y postion of start of title. In page units not data units. 0 is far left of visible page, 1 far right. Remember plots are in portrait so Y is the axes of the taxa (see manual).
Specify font size for title
Specify rotation of title in degrees ( 90 degrees if as in example plots in manual)
Adjust gap between title and plots (most likley range is between 0 - 0.5)

Specify title text colour (1 = black, 2 = gray, 3 = dimgray, 4 = darkgray, 5 = slategray, 6 = light gray, 7 = red, 8 = darkred, 9 = orangered, 10 = coral, 11 = green, 12 = darkgreen, 13 = olive, 14 = lightgreen, 15 = blue, 16 = darkblue, 17 = lightblue, 18 = cyan, 19 = yellow, 20 = brown, 21 = magenta, 22 = orange, 23 = white
Specify if title text is to be bold or not. Enter word "on" or "off".
Provide footer text if footer is required
Specify if Footer text is to be visible or not. Enter word "on" or "off".
X postion of start of footer. In page units not data units. 0 is far left of visible page, 1 far right.  Remember plots are in portrait so X is the depth axis (see manual).
Y Position of start of footer - is page units not data units 0, is lowest position of visible page , 1 highest. Remember plots are in portrait so Y is the axes of the taxa (see manual).
Specify font size for footer
Specify rotation of footer in degrees (90 degrees if as in example plots in manual)
